xbrli:xbrl.in-bse-fin:DisclosureOfNotesOnFinancialR:
Notes to Financial Results:

1. . Formulae for computation of ratios are as follows :

i. Debt Service Coverage Ratio = Earnings before Interest, Tax and exceptional Items
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Interest Expense + Principal Repayments made during
the period for long term loans

ii. Interest Service Coverage Ratio = Earnings before Interest, Tax and exceptional Items
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Interest Expense

iii. Debt/ Equity Ratio = Total Debt
------------------
Total Equity


iv. Current ratio = Current Assets
---------------------
Current Liabilities

v. Long term debt to working capital = Non-Current Borrowings (Including Current Maturities of
Non-Current Borrowings)
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Current Assets Less Current Liabilities (Excluding Current
Maturities of Non-Current Borrowings)

vi. Bad debts to Account receivable = Bad Debts
ratio ------------------
Average Trade Receivables


vii. Current liability ratio = Total Current Liabilities
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Total Liabilities

viii. Total debts to total assets = Total Debt
-----------------
Total Assets

ix. Debtors turnover = Value of Sales & Services
----------------------------------
Average Trade Receivables

x. Inventory turnover = Cost of Goods Sold (Cost of Material Consumed+ Purchases +
Changes in Inventory + Manufacturing Expenses)
----------------------------------
Average Inventories of Finished Goods, Stock-in-Process and
Stock-in-Trade


xi. Operating margin (%) = Earnings before Interest, Tax and Exceptional Items
less Other Income
----------------------------------
Value of Sales & Services


xii. Net profit margin (%) = Profit After Tax (after exceptional items)
-------------------------------------------------------
Value of Sales & Services



Notes to Cash Flow:

1. Changes in Trade and Other Receivables have been shown under Adjustments for decrease / (increase) in trade receivables, current.

2. Changes in Trade and Other Payables have been shown under Adjustments for increase / (decrease) in trade payables, current.
xbrli:xbrl.in-bse-fin:DisclosureOfNotesOnAssetsAndL:
1. Other non current financial liabilities include Lease Liabilities of Rs. 2,780 Crore.

2. Other current financial liabilities include Lease Liabilities of Rs. 63 Crore.

3. Net Worth as at 30th September 2022 is Rs. 433,683 Crore.

4. Outstanding Capital Redemption Reserve/Debenture Redemption Reserve as at 30th September 2022 is Rs. 2,908 Crore.

5. Further, the following ratios which form part of the Standalone Financial Results for the quarter and half year ended 30th September, 2022, are reproduced below, as there are no rows designated for the same in the XBRL format:

Ratio Quarter ended Half Year ended
30th September, 2022 30th September, 2022

A) Current ratio 0.98 0.98
B) Long Term Debt to Working Capital 7.25 7.25
C) Bad Debts to Account Receivable Ratio 0.00 0.00
D) Current Liability Ratio 0.53 0.53
E) Total Debt to Total Assets 0.24 0.24
F) Debtors Turnover Ratio $ 31.99 39.96
G) Inventory Turnover Ratio $ 13.87 16.49
H) Operating Margin (%) 6.4 9.6
I) Net Profit Margin (%) * 4.7 7.2

$ Ratios for the quarter / half year have been annualised.
* Includes Exceptional Items.
xbrli:xbrl.in-bse-fin:DisclosureOfNotesOnSegmentsEx:
1. Q2 FY23 Segment Revenue includes Rs 5,952 crore GST recovered. Net Revenue is Rs 140,358 crore.

2. H1 FY23 Segment Revenue includes Rs 12,325 crore GST recovered. Net Revenue is Rs 291,701 crore.

3. Oil to Chemicals and Financial Services Segment results includes Interest income/Other Income pertaining to the respective segments.

4. Segment assets and liabilities have been grossed up, with respect to advance from customers, bill discounting and other non-current assets whereas the same are netted off in the respective heads of Balance Sheet.

Amount of items that will not be reclassified to profit and loss
